name: ExpressJS
desc: Express.js, or simply Express, is a JavaScript framework designed for building web applications and APIs.

name: MongoDB
desc:
The de-facto Database solution for JavaScript and Node.js applications. It is a light weight,
		high performance NoSQL database and can be used for small and large websites.

name: TypeScript2
desc:
The strict-typing flavor of ECMAScript, always requires a compiler to compile to vanilla JavaScript
		but the type checking and other syntactical sugar are exceptional.

name: NodeJS
desc:
Node.js is a cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment. 
		Node.js allows creation of high performance and high concurrency websites with smaller footprint compared to
		other server-side solution.

name: DOTNETCore
desc: .NET Core is a general purpose development platform maintained by Microsoft and the .NET community on GitHub.

name: ASPDOTNET
desc: ASP.NET is an open-source server-side web application framework designed for web development to produce dynamic web pages.

name: C#
desc: C# (pronounced as see sharp) is a multi-paradigm programming language encompassing strong typing, imperative, declarative, functional, generic, object-oriented (class-based), and component-oriented programming disciplines.

name: Electron
desc: Electron (formerly known as Atom Shell) is an open-source framework created by Cheng Zhao, and now developed by GitHub.

name: React
desc: In computing, React (sometimes styled React.js or ReactJS) is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

name: C
desc: C is a general-purpose, imperative computer programming language, supporting structured programming, lexical variable scope and recursion, while a static type system prevents many unintended operations.

name: Go
desc: Go is an open source programming language that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software.

name: Angular
desc: Angular is a TypeScript-based open-source front-end web application platform led by the Angular Team at Google.

name: Clojure
desc: Clojure is a dynamic, general-purpose programming language, combining the approachability and interactive development of a scripting language with an efficient and robust infrastructure for multithreaded programming.

name: Cordova/Ionic
desc: Ionic empowers web developers to build leading cross-platform mobile apps and Progressive Web Apps (PWAs).

name: F#
desc: F# is a mature, open source, cross-platform, functional-first programming language. It empowers users and organizations to tackle complex computing problems with simple, maintainable and robust code.

name: Haskell
desc: Haskell is a standardized, general-purpose purely functional programming language, with non-strict semantics and strong static typing.

name: Swagger/JSON:API
desc: Swagger UI allows development team to visualize and interact with the API's resources without having any of the implementation logic in place.

name: React Native
desc: React Native lets you build mobile apps using only JavaScript. It uses the same design as React, letting you compose a rich mobile UI from declarative components.

name: Rust
desc: Rust is a systems programming language that runs blazingly fast, prevents segfaults, and guarantees thread safety.

name: Web Assembly
desc: WebAssembly or wasm is a low-level bytecode format for in-browser client-side scripting, evolved from JavaScript.

name: Xamarin
desc: Xamarin is a Microsoft-owned San Francisco, California-based software company founded in May 2011 by the engineers that created Mono.

name: Firebase
desc: Firebase is Google's mobile platform that helps you quickly develop high-quality apps and grow your business.

name: RxJs
desc: RxJS is a library for reactive programming using Observables, to make it easier to compose asynchronous or callback-based code.

name: C++
desc: C++ is a general-purpose programming language. It has imperative, object-oriented and generic programming features.

name: Java
desc: Java is a general-purpose computer programming language that is concurrent, class-based, object-oriented.

name: Redux
desc: Redux is a predictable state container for JavaScript apps.

name: Preact
desc: Fast 3kB alternative to React with the same modern API.

name: PostgreSQL
desc: PostgreSQL is an open-source relational database management system (RDBMS) emphasizing extensibility and standards compliance.

name: MySQL
desc: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.

name: GatsbyJS
desc: Blazing fast modern site generator for React. Go beyond static sites: build blogs, ecommerce sites, full-blown apps, and more with Gatsby.

name: GraphQL
desc: GraphQL is a query language for your API, and a server-side runtime for executing queries by using a type system you define for your data.

name: Next.js
desc: Next.js is an open-source web development framework created by the private company Vercel providing React-based web applications with server-side rendering and static website generation.

name: Kotlin
desc: Kotlin is a cross-platform, statically typed, general-purpose high-level programming language with type inference.

name: Swift
desc: Swift is a high-level general-purpose, multi-paradigm, compiled programming language developed by Apple Inc. and the open-source community.
